result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark M Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early release after 12 months if the Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with his minor children.  No contact with Kelly F. except for custody and family court proceedings.  To keep up to date on support for minor children.  Contact with the children per the family court case 15FA821.  Parenting classes.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Restitution to be determined at next courtdate.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AMENDED 12/08/2015:  COURT ORDERED RESTITUTION TO BE SET AT ZERO.

Defendant Mark M Schuster in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 in the amended information.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court addresses the restitution claim filed by the mother of the minor child.  State will not represent the mother regarding restitution.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count 1 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITION concurrent.  
Term of Probation: 18 months 
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No Violent contact with his minor children.
No contact with Kelly F except for custody and family court proceedings.
To keep up to date on support for the minor children.  
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Contact with the children per the family court case 15FA821.  
Parenting classes
Early release after 12 months if the agent deems appropriate
Condition Time: 60 days Non working hours STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: To be determined. 
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

The Court Orders the Following:
Count 2 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

60 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS concurrent.  
Term of Probation: 18 months 
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No Violent contact with his minor children.
No contact with Kelly F except for custody and family court proceedings.
To keep up to date on support for the minor children.  
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Contact with the children per the family court case 15FA821.  
Parenting classes
Early release after 12 months if the agent deems appropriate
Restitution: To be determined. 
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant Mark M Schuster in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses defendant's motion for bail modification.  Defense files copy of order.  Court would like the input of the GAL who is expected to be appointed shortly.  Court takes the motion to modify bail under advisement pending receipt of information from the GAL.  Family case 15FA821 to be brought into court with this matter at the next hearing.  Court will also set this matter for trial as defendant has entered a speedy trial demand.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
